body_html:
Hi All: We have checked in an initial support for distributed TF, such that the changes for distributed memory are abstracted from the user. The code is available at: https://github.com/abhinavvishnu/matex/tree/master/src/deeplearning Please find the documentation at https://github.com/abhinavvishnu/matex/wiki We have tested it on GPU clusters and CPU clusters. To do: 1) multi-GPU support 2) Keras integration 3) A document which describes our changes. Thanks, please let us know if you have any questions. Sincerely, ;- Abhinav On Tue, Feb 28, 2017 at 4:37 AM, Ido Shamay <notifications@github.com> wrote:
…
I guess it depends on the model and how much the computation part is VS the network part of the model. Can u elaborate about the application/model/network being used ? On Tue, Feb 28, 2017 at 7:39 AM, kaizhigaosu ***@***.***> wrote: > I has a distributed tensorflow case which has 2 workers, but the speed up > is only near 1. I don't know if it is related with this issue you > discussed. Can you have a look? > http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42500739/between- > graph-replication-of-ptb-rnn-model-is-slower-than-single-gpu-version > <http://url> > > — > You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/ 2916#issuecomment-282947494>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ AVPgz8aN30NBFHj6Wqc0DHUzovjtmUKfks5rg7MngaJpZM4I35Qd> > . > -- *Ido* — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#2916 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGMD779fbceq-W4fGBc3Jv7zB1xHGVJ9ks5rhBTsgaJpZM4I35Qd> .
-- Abhinav Vishnu Research Scientist Pacific Northwest National Lab Richland, WA 99352
body_text:
Hi All:

We have checked in an initial support for distributed TF, such that the
changes for distributed memory are abstracted from the user. The code is
available at:

https://github.com/abhinavvishnu/matex/tree/master/src/deeplearning

Please find the documentation at https://github.com/abhinavvishnu/matex/wiki

We have tested it on GPU clusters and CPU clusters.

To do:

1) multi-GPU support
2) Keras integration
3) A document which describes our changes.

Thanks, please let us know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

;- Abhinav

On Tue, Feb 28, 2017 at 4:37 AM, Ido Shamay <notifications@github.com>
wrote:
…
 I guess it depends on the model and how much the computation part is VS the
 network part of the model.
 Can u elaborate about the application/model/network being used ?

 On Tue, Feb 28, 2017 at 7:39 AM, kaizhigaosu ***@***.***>
 wrote:

 > I has a distributed tensorflow case which has 2 workers, but the speed up
 > is only near 1. I don't know if it is related with this issue you
 > discussed. Can you have a look?
 > http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42500739/between-
 > graph-replication-of-ptb-rnn-model-is-slower-than-single-gpu-version
 > <http://url>

Pacific Northwest National Lab
Richland, WA 99352
body:
Hi All:

We have checked in an initial support for distributed TF, such that the
changes for distributed memory are abstracted from the user. The code is
available at:

https://github.com/abhinavvishnu/matex/tree/master/src/deeplearning

Please find the documentation at https://github.com/abhinavvishnu/matex/wiki

We have tested it on GPU clusters and CPU clusters.

To do:

1) multi-GPU support
2) Keras integration
3) A document which describes our changes.

Thanks, please let us know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

;- Abhinav
